intro: Pedicularis yinshanensis, commonly known as the Yinshan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
